[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@threebird/controls](./controls.md) &gt; [Damper](./controls.damper.md)

## Damper class

Damper uses simple linear damping for a given collection of values. On every call to update, the damper will approach a given set of target values.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare class Damper 
```

## Example


```js
const damper = new Damper({
 values: {x: 0, y: 0},
 dampingFactor: 0.4
})

damper.setTarget({ x: 1, y: 100 })
damper.update() // would generally be called in an animation loop
const values = damper.getCurrentValues() // values.x = 0.4; values.y = 40

```

## Methods

|  Method | Modifiers | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [addToTarget(key, value)](./controls.damper.addtotarget.md) |  | Increment/Decrement a specifc damper target value |
|  [getCurrentValues()](./controls.damper.getcurrentvalues.md) |  | Get the current values |
|  [getDeltaValues()](./controls.damper.getdeltavalues.md) |  | Get the change in values since the last update call |
|  [reachedTarget()](./controls.damper.reachedtarget.md) |  | Whether the damper has reached its target |
|  [resetAll(value)](./controls.damper.resetall.md) |  | Reset all damper values to the fiven number |
|  [resetData(values)](./controls.damper.resetdata.md) |  | Reset damper values as described by the given DamperValues object |
|  [setTarget(target)](./controls.damper.settarget.md) |  | Set the target values the damper needs to approach |
|  [update()](./controls.damper.update.md) |  | Update the damper, should generally be called on every frame |
